contest-event.event-date:
July 19, 1912 D Tynemouth Contest
Tynemouth Contest 0 Test Piece Contest
tynemouth-contest
None
March & Own Choice Test Piece Contest
Apollo
Selection (test piece Apollo) plus own choice march.
March contest results:
- 1st Harton Colliery (J Oliver, "Conquerer", Â£1 10s) - 2nd South Shields Temperance (J W Taylor, "BB and CF")
Mr Bower's adjudication of Harton Colliery's performance of Conquerer:
"Splendid start; grand to listen to; Sop a little sharp on top notes; Sop again a little faulty; a grand brisk style; basses quite a feature and accompaniments very neat. Trio: Melody a little out of tune; you are too anxious; cornet entry good; perhaps the wind is interfering; it is rather boisterous [nb I think Mr Bower was actually referring to the wind with this comment - it is noted elsewhere that the conditions on the day were "boisterous"]; everthing good; p's and f's well observed; tone of band good. Second time through much better and Sop improves; everything just now is grand; bass solo excellent. A really splendid performance to a march you are equal to."
July 25, 2012, 2:17 p.m. July 29, 2012, 12:37 p.m.
1 Marsden Colliery J. W. Taylor
2 Backworth Colliery Band S. F. Howells
3 Westoe Band James Oliver
4 Brancepeth Welfare Band J. B. Wright
5 Amble and Radcliffe Colliery Chris Johnson
